ygData.subject: Re: BEST PLAYER COMBO
ygData.msgSnippet: Don t know where you re getting the Iskar monks do less damage than regular. And I know that the reason I abandoned the monk I had was b/c the money
ygData.messageBody:
Don't know where you're getting the Iskar monks
do less damage than regular.<br><br>And I know that
the reason I abandoned the monk I had was b/c the
money issue hurt badly. And yes, I was saying that that
was a drawback of all monks. There had been one point
where someone was asking about what classes and combos
were good to play. Sounded like a new player. Don't
play monk if you don't want to have to worry about
money as a newbie.<br><br>And yes, perm sight is
available. But you have to find the thing. I know that's an
item I haven't seen much of or even seen sold much.
Except for sometimes in NFP and already having monk cash
problems-- I couldn't afford to purchase it.<br><br>Back to
dual wield. Thanks. Didn't know humans also get dual
wield at level 1. But I know that at level 7 with
nothing more than fists and no special gloves, I was
doing a lot more damage than my human monk at the same
level. I can take out even cons with barely a scratch at
level 7. I went through level 1 to 5 with no equipment
as an Iskar monk and having never played in Calabis
in about 2 days, 3 1/2 hours of play. I knew FP and
my human monk did no where as well. <br><br>And the
conditions where equally equiped monks. Which usually tips
the favor into Iskar monks. If damage is less for
Iskar, I haven't noticed it. My fists (again no weapons,
no special gloves) do about 1 to 17 per fist
(average 10) and every 4 or so attacks my other fist
lands. Sooooo....<br><br>Unless there's a huge
difference, I've played human monk to level 9 with much
effort and played maybe at most 6 hours to get to level
7 monk iskar with no problems. Didn't even die but
twice as an Iskar monk and once from mend wound killing
me when it crit failed.<br><br>shooman out
<br><br>PS.. keep in mind my level 39 druid has equipment so
lousy that 4 levels ago, someone asked if I was about
the delete the character so gave my items away. I
couldn't afford to do anything but give my monk 3
backpacks for his bank.
